alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Reeves County Plains (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 3:55PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Pecos, south central Reeves and eastern Jeff Davis Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 355 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southeast of Balmorhea Lake, or 28 miles northeast of Fort Davis, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Pecos, south central Reeves and eastern Jeff Davis Counties. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 226 and 242. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
